result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael A Gonzales was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
-Sentence credit of 182 days is granted. 
-Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program. 
-Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
Concurrent with: -With any current sentence.

superMiscConds.notes:
-Costs to be paid as a condition of probation. 
-Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

-Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. 
-All prescriptions to be filled at the same pharmacy.

-Obtain full time employment (35 hours per week) within first 30 days of extended supervision. 
-Maintain a valid driver's license. 
-No new law violations. 
-If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael A Gonzales

defendant.name: Gonzales, Michael A
defendant.address: PO Box 282, C/O Kettle Moraine Correctional Institution, Plymouth, WI 53073-0282

records.addlTxt: Detainer Lift: Kettle Moraine Correctional Institution
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

10:42 AM Defendant Michael A Gonzales in court, in custody.  Attorney Jessica A Klein in court for Michael A Gonzales.  Attorney Ted Szczupakiewicz in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case called for jury status hearing.  
Parties have reached an agreement.
Court conducts plea colloquy.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty.  Case 21CF1612 is dismissed and read in to this matter.
Recommendations by the State.  Recommendations by the Defense.  Statement by defendant.

The Court Orders the Following:

Count 1:
24 Months Imprisonment (Credit - 182 Days). CONCURRENT with any current sentence.
-	12 Months of Initial Confinement
-	12 Months of Extended Supervision

Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program

Conditions of Extended Supervision:
-	Absolute Sobriety; 
-	Random U.A.'s;
-	No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia;
-	All prescriptions to be filled at the same pharmacy
-	No use or possession of any controlled substances without a valid doctor's prescription;
-	Obtain full time employment (35 hours per week) within first 30 days of extended supervision;
-	Maintain a valid Driver's License;
-	No new law violations;

COSTS:  $ 243.00

DNA Surcharge: $ 200.00

DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 

Total costs/fine/forfeiture:  to be paid as a condition of extended supervision. Failure to pay;  will result in a civil judgment.
